headline: The Glass Room 2.0
description: In December 2016, Mozilla and Tactical Tech set up The Glass Room, a Manhattan-based exhibit exploring life online. Stay tuned for the next iteration.

headline: Education Innovation Showcase
description: EdTech Austin and Mozilla Hive Austin are bringing together -- and celebrating -- a range of education organizations in Austin, TX.

headline: Digital Skills Observatory (DSO) research published
description: DSO is a 12-month research project carried out by Mozilla and partners, and supported by the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation. Research explores how low-income, first-time Internet users in Kenya experience online life.

headline: Hive Chicago Buzz
description: Hive Chicago Buzz is a two-day hackathon where educators and learners co-create solutions to Chicago’s education challenges.

headline: Global Sprint
description: Mozilla’s Global Sprint is a fun, fast-paced and two-day collaborative event to hack and build projects for a healthy Internet.

headline: Gigabit grant applications due
description: Innovators in the gigabit cities of Austin, Chattanooga, Eugene (OR), Lafayette (LA) and Kansas City can seek support for projects that leverage next-generation Internet. Applications are due August 1, 2017.

headline: MozFest call for proposals deadline
description: Propose a session at MozFest, Mozilla’s annual open Internet festival. Sessions range from hands-on workshops to lightning talks, and should relate to Internet health. Submissions are due August 1.

headline: Open Web Fellows announced
description: Meet some of the Network’s brightest minds: promising technologists and activists working toward a better web (and society).

headline: SRCCON
description: An annual conference for the journalists and technologists bringing open source into newsrooms. Hosted by Network member organization OpenNews.

headline: NSF Wireless Innovation for a Networked Society Challenges
description: A total of $2 million in prize money is available for wireless solutions that get people online after disasters or that connect communities lacking reliable Internet access. Intent to Apply submissions will be accepted through October 15, 2017.

headline: Internet Health Report
description: Our annual publication documenting the health of the web. An open source project drawing on data and storytelling.

headline: MozFest
description: The world's leading festival for the open Internet movement. Held annually, MozFest features hands-on workshops, keynotes, hackathons and science fairs.

headline: Open Web Fellows applications open
description: Technologists and activists: apply to embed at leading nonprofits fighting for social change. Fellows announced in August.
